    <mr-cue centered="" cueprefname="search_for_numbers" hidden=""></mr-cue>
      
          
      
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

      Chrome Version       : 108.0.5359.124  109.0.5414.74 <span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version       : 108.0.5359.124  109.0.5414.74 <!----></span><br>URLs (if applicable) :<b class="line"><!---->URLs (if applicable) :<!----></b><br>None (published patch date)<span class="line"><!---->None (published patch date)<!----></span><br>TALOS-2023-1693<span class="line"><!---->TALOS-2023-1693<!----></span><br><br>Google Chrome WebRTC RTCStatsCollector out of bounds memory access vulnerability<span class="line"><!---->Google Chrome WebRTC RTCStatsCollector out of bounds memory access vulnerability<!----></span><br>Summary<span class="line"><!---->Summary<!----></span><br><br>An out of bounds memory access vulnerability exists in stats reporting functionality of the WebRTC implementation in Google Chrome 109.0.5414.74 and 108.0.5359.124. A specially-crafted malicious web page can trigger an out-of-bounds access which can lead to type confusion and further memory corruption. A victim would need to navigate to a malicious webpage to trigger this vulnerability.<span class="line"><!---->An out of bounds memory access vulnerability exists in stats reporting functionality of the WebRTC implementation in Google Chrome 109.0.5414.74 and 108.0.5359.124. A specially-crafted malicious web page can trigger an out-of-bounds access which can lead to type confusion and further memory corruption. A victim would need to navigate to a malicious webpage to trigger this vulnerability.<!----></span><br>Confirmed Vulnerable Versions<span class="line"><!---->Confirmed Vulnerable Versions<!----></span><br><br>The versions below were either tested or verified to be vulnerable by Talos or confirmed to be vulnerable by the vendor.<span class="line"><!---->The versions below were either tested or verified to be vulnerable by Talos or confirmed to be vulnerable by the vendor.<!----></span><br><br>Google Chrome 108.0.5359.124<span class="line"><!---->Google Chrome 108.0.5359.124<!----></span><br>Google Chrome 109.0.5414.74<span class="line"><!---->Google Chrome 109.0.5414.74<!----></span><br>Product URLs<span class="line"><!---->Product URLs<!----></span><br><br>Chrome - <span class="line"><!---->Chrome - <!----></span>https://www.google.com/chrome/<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://www.google.com/chrome/"><!---->https://www.google.com/chrome/<!----></a><br>CVSSv3 Score<span class="line"><!---->CVSSv3 Score<!----></span><br><br>8.3 - CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:R/S:U/C:H/I:H/A:L<span class="line"><!---->8.3 - CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:R/S:U/C:H/I:H/A:L<!----></span><br>CWE<span class="line"><!---->CWE<!----></span><br><br>CWE-129 - Improper Validation of Array Index<span class="line"><!---->CWE-129 - Improper Validation of Array Index<!----></span><br>Details<span class="line"><!---->Details<!----></span><br><br>Google Chrome is a cross-platform web browser developed by Google and is currently the most popular web browser. One of the features it supports is WebRTC which is primarily used for implementing web applications for real-time communication.<span class="line"><!---->Google Chrome is a cross-platform web browser developed by Google and is currently the most popular web browser. One of the features it supports is WebRTC which is primarily used for implementing web applications for real-time communication.<!----></span><br><br>PeerConnection object has a method called getStats which returns statistics about the overall connection. When generating stats report, the request is handled by the signaling thread.<span class="line"><!---->PeerConnection object has a method called getStats which returns statistics about the overall connection. When generating stats report, the request is handled by the signaling thread.<!----></span><br><br>Class responsible for generating the report is RTCStatsCollector. Collector uses caching to avoid doing expensive operations on each request. Therefore, if the request was received inside the caching window and there is previously generated cached report, that is delivered instead. If not, code goes into generating a new status report by generating partial results from network and signal thread and merging them.<span class="line"><!---->Class responsible for generating the report is RTCStatsCollector. Collector uses caching to avoid doing expensive operations on each request. Therefore, if the request was received inside the caching window and there is previously generated cached report, that is delivered instead. If not, code goes into generating a new status report by generating partial results from network and signal thread and merging them.<!----></span><br><br>RTCStatsCollector::ProducePartialResultsOnNetworkThread(...) is responsible for generating partial results on the network thread.<span class="line"><!---->RTCStatsCollector::ProducePartialResultsOnNetworkThread(...) is responsible for generating partial results on the network thread.<!----></span><br><br>void RTCStatsCollector::ProducePartialResultsOnNetworkThread(<span class="line"><!---->void RTCStatsCollector::ProducePartialResultsOnNetworkThread(<!----></span><br>    int64_t timestamp_us,<span class="line"><!---->    int64_t timestamp_us,<!----></span><br>    absl::optional<std::string> sctp_transport_name) {<span class="line"><!---->    absl::optional&lt;std::string&gt; sctp_transport_name) {<!----></span><br>  // ...<span class="line"><!---->  // ...<!----></span><br><br>  std::set<std::string> transport_names;<span class="line"><!---->  std::set&lt;std::string&gt; transport_names;<!----></span><br>  if (sctp_transport_name) {<span class="line"><!---->  if (sctp_transport_name) {<!----></span><br>    transport_names.emplace(std::move(*sctp_transport_name));<span class="line"><!---->    transport_names.emplace(std::move(*sctp_transport_name));<!----></span><br>  }<span class="line"><!---->  }<!----></span><br><br>  for (const auto& info : transceiver_stats_infos_) {<span class="line"><!---->  for (const auto&amp; info : transceiver_stats_infos_) {<!----></span><br>    if (info.transport_name)<span class="line"><!---->    if (info.transport_name)<!----></span><br>      transport_names.insert(*info.transport_name);<span class="line"><!---->      transport_names.insert(*info.transport_name);<!----></span><br>  }<span class="line"><!---->  }<!----></span><br><br>  std::map<std::string, cricket::TransportStats> transport_stats_by_name =<span class="line"><!---->  std::map&lt;std::string, cricket::TransportStats&gt; transport_stats_by_name =<!----></span><br>      pc_->GetTransportStatsByNames(transport_names);<span class="line"><!---->      pc_-&gt;GetTransportStatsByNames(transport_names);<!----></span><br>  std::map<std::string, CertificateStatsPair> transport_cert_stats =<span class="line"><!---->  std::map&lt;std::string, CertificateStatsPair&gt; transport_cert_stats =<!----></span><br>      PrepareTransportCertificateStats_n(transport_stats_by_name);<span class="line"><!---->      PrepareTransportCertificateStats_n(transport_stats_by_name);<!----></span><br><br>  ProducePartialResultsOnNetworkThreadImpl(<span class="line"><!---->  ProducePartialResultsOnNetworkThreadImpl(<!----></span><br>      timestamp_us, transport_stats_by_name, transport_cert_stats,<span class="line"><!---->      timestamp_us, transport_stats_by_name, transport_cert_stats,<!----></span><br>      network_report_.get());<span class="line"><!---->      network_report_.get());<!----></span><br><br>  // ...<span class="line"><!---->  // ...<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br><br>Function gathers all the transport names from sctp_transport_name, which was passed on to the task by calling PeerConnection::sctp_transport_name(), and |transceiver_stats_infos_| member field. These names are used to generate maps of cricket::TransportStats and CertificateStatsPair.<span class="line"><!---->Function gathers all the transport names from sctp_transport_name, which was passed on to the task by calling PeerConnection::sctp_transport_name(), and |transceiver_stats_infos_| member field. These names are used to generate maps of cricket::TransportStats and CertificateStatsPair.<!----></span><br><br>If we look at the implemenation of RTCStatsCollector::PrepareTransportCertificateStats_n(...), we can see the following:<span class="line"><!---->If we look at the implemenation of RTCStatsCollector::PrepareTransportCertificateStats_n(...), we can see the following:<!----></span><br><br>// creates a new map<span class="line"><!---->// creates a new map<!----></span><br>std::map<std::string, CertificateStatsPair> transport_cert_stats;<span class="line"><!---->std::map&lt;std::string, CertificateStatsPair&gt; transport_cert_stats;<!----></span><br>  {<span class="line"><!---->  {<!----></span><br>    MutexLock lock(&cached_certificates_mutex_);<span class="line"><!---->    MutexLock lock(&amp;cached_certificates_mutex_);<!----></span><br>    // Copy the certificate info from the cache, avoiding expensive<span class="line"><!---->    // Copy the certificate info from the cache, avoiding expensive<!----></span><br>    // rtc::SSLCertChain::GetStats() calls.<span class="line"><!---->    // rtc::SSLCertChain::GetStats() calls.<!----></span><br>    for (const auto& pair : cached_certificates_by_transport_) {<span class="line"><!---->    for (const auto&amp; pair : cached_certificates_by_transport_) {<!----></span><br>      transport_cert_stats.insert(<span class="line"><!---->      transport_cert_stats.insert(<!----></span><br>          std::make_pair(pair.first, pair.second.Copy()));<span class="line"><!---->          std::make_pair(pair.first, pair.second.Copy()));<!----></span><br>    }<span class="line"><!---->    }<!----></span><br>  }<span class="line"><!---->  }<!----></span><br>  if (transport_cert_stats.empty()) {<span class="line"><!---->  if (transport_cert_stats.empty()) {<!----></span><br>    // in cases when the cache was empty, it generates new stats<span class="line"><!---->    // in cases when the cache was empty, it generates new stats<!----></span><br><br>It first declares |transport_cert_stats| map and inserts values from the |cached_certificates_by_transport_|. If there was nothing in the cache then it continues to fill the map with newly generated stats.<span class="line"><!---->It first declares |transport_cert_stats| map and inserts values from the |cached_certificates_by_transport_|. If there was nothing in the cache then it continues to fill the map with newly generated stats.<!----></span><br><br>At the end of the function it inserts newly generated stats or cached stats back into the cache again.<span class="line"><!---->At the end of the function it inserts newly generated stats or cached stats back into the cache again.<!----></span><br><br>for (const auto& pair : transport_cert_stats) {<span class="line"><!---->for (const auto&amp;         Thank you for that wonderfully detailed report. The certificate cache was added in M108 (<span class="line"><!---->Thank you for that wonderfully detailed report. The certificate cache was added in M108 (<!----></span>https://crbug.com/webrtc/14458<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/webrtc/issues/detail?id=14458" title="Add a cache for RTCCertificateStats"><!---->https://crbug.com/webrtc/14458<!----></a>) so let's assume that's where the bug first appeared.<span class="line"><!---->) so let's assume that's where the bug first appeared.<!----></span><br><br>I propose we fix this by handling the "certificate not found" case (it == end) by simply not setting the IDs in this case.         I wonder if the problem is that the cache is not cleared in all cases that it should be cleared, or if the problem is that this is inherently racy due to objects being created/destroyed on one thread and modified/stats collected on another thread, but it is interesting to note that this DCHECK has existed for several years so it is likely that it is caching related.<span class="line"><!---->I wonder if the problem is that the cache is not cleared in all cases that it should be cleared, or if the problem is that this is inherently racy due to objects being created/destroyed on one thread and modified/stats collected on another thread, but it is interesting to note that this DCHECK has existed for several years so it is likely that it is caching related.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Oh I see, creating a data channel may update the SCTP transport name but we forget to clear the cache.<span class="line"><!---->Oh I see, creating a data channel may update the SCTP transport name but we forget to clear the cache.<!----></span><br><br>So security issue can be avoided by handling the DCHECK case and the issue of certificates not being found due to caching can be fixed by clearing the cache. I'll write fixes for both of these, but perhaps we should only backmerge the DCHECK case to miniize risks.<span class="line"><!---->So security issue can be avoided by handling the DCHECK case and the issue of certificates not being found due to caching can be fixed by clearing the cache.         1. Why? This is a high severity security issue.<span class="line"><!---->1. Why? This is a high severity security issue.<!----></span><br>2. <span class="line"><!---->2. <!----></span>https://webrtc-review.googlesource.com/c/src/+/291109<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://webrtc-review.googlesource.com/c/src/+/291109"><!---->https://webrtc-review.googlesource.com/c/src/+/291109<!----></a><br>3. Still waiting for the Canary release of <span class="line"><!---->3. Still waiting for the Canary release of <!----></span>https://chromiumdash.appspot.com/commit/124d7c3fe5bdc79a355c9df02d07f25331631a68..<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromiumdash.appspot.com/commit/124d7c3fe5bdc79a355c9df02d07f25331631a68.."><!---->https://chromiumdash.appspot.com/commit/124d7c3fe5bdc79a355c9df02d07f25331631a68..<!----></a>.<span class="line"><!---->.<!----></span> however I have been unable to repro on custom builds or Canary prior to the fix, so I don't know how to manually confirm this, but looking at the code you can tell it is a very simple and safe fix.<span class="line"><!----> however I have been unable to repro on custom builds or Canary prior to the fix, so I don't know how to manually confirm this, but looking at the code you can tell it is a very simple and safe fix.<!----></span><br>4. No<span class="line"><!---->4. No<!----></span><br>5. N/A<span class="line"><!---->5. N/A<!----></span><br>6. While a repro was provided in <span class="line"><!---->6.         A few things here, updating this issue as fixed as requesting merges before updating the bugs as Fixed interferes with our automation. Also, given this is a high-severity fix that is FoundIn-108, letting the bot do it's job would have been key to updating this with all the relevant merge request labels, including to M108, as this issue impacts Extended Stable. M109/Stable and M108/Extended respin RC cut deadline was Friday (or for some reason again today) so this fix missed merge for that. <span class="line"><!---->A few things here, updating this issue as fixed as requesting merges before updating the bugs as Fixed interferes with our automation. Also, given this is a high-severity fix that is FoundIn-108, letting the bot do it's job would have been key to updating this with all the relevant merge request labels, including to M108, as this issue impacts Extended Stable. M109/Stable and M108/Extended respin RC cut deadline was Friday (or for some reason again today) so this fix missed merge for that. <!----></span><br>Given the timelines, M109/Stable backmerge is no longer relevant. Removing the M109 merge label accordingly. <span class="line"><!---->Given the timelines, M109/Stable backmerge is no longer relevant. Removing the M109 merge label accordingly. <!----></span><br><br>In the future, please updated security bugs as Fixed as soon as the fix is landed. This allows Fixed security bugs to get labeled for the appropriate merge reviews, based on severity and impact AND gets them into the merge review queue as soon as possible. This is important in helping us keep our patch gap as small as possible and helps to combat n-day exploitation of our security bugs. Thank you to you and the webRTC team with this :)<span class="line"><!---->In the future, please updated security bugs as Fixed as soon as the fix is landed. This allows Fixed security bugs to get labeled for the appropriate merge reviews, based on severity and impact AND gets them into the merge review queue as soon as possible. This is important in helping us keep our patch gap as small as possible and helps to combat n-day exploitation of our security bugs. Thank you to you and the webRTC team with this :)<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */

          position: relative;

      <style>
        
  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);

  }

      text-align: left;

    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

        mr-app {
          display: block;
          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

          /* From shared-styles.js. */
          --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
          --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
          --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
          font-family: var(--chops-font-family);

        }

          border-top: var(--chops-normal-border);
        }

        }
        /** Unfix <chops-snackbar> to allow stacking. */
        chops-snackbar {
          position: static;
          margin-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .project-alert {
          background: var(--chops-orange-50);

  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

        mr-app {
          display: block;
          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

          /* From shared-styles.js. */
          --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
          --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
          --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
          font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
          color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
        }
        main {
          border-top: var(--chops-normal-border);
        }
        .snackbar-container {
          position: fixed;
          bottom: 1em;
          left: 1em;
          display: flex;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: flex-start;
          z-index: 1000;
        }
        /** Unfix <chops-snackbar> to allow stacking. */
        chops-snackbar {
          position: static;
          margin-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .project-alert {
          background: var(--chops-orange-50);
          color: var(--chops-field-error-color);
          display: block;

          text-align: center;

              <span></span>Anywhere<span class="help-title"><!---->Anywhere<!----></span>

                  <!---->:

              <!---->

              <span></span><span class="help-title"><!---->Anywhere<!----></span>

          Note: Only signed in users can star issues or add comments, and
          only project members can select issues for bulk edits.

        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

            Issue 1408392: TALOS-2023-1693 - Google Chrome WebRTC RTCStatsCollector out of bounds memory access vulnerability 
          <h1>
            
            Issue 1408392: TALOS-2023-1693 - Google Chrome WebRTC RTCStatsCollector out of bounds memory access vulnerability 
          </h1>
          
            Reported by
            
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>
      vulnd...@sourcefire.com<a id="user-link" href="/u/3950007980" title="vulnd...@sourcefire.com"><!---->vulnd...@sourcefire.com<!----></a>
      vulnd...@sourcefire.com<span id="user-text" hidden=""><!---->vulnd...@sourcefire.com<!----></span>
      <div id="availability-text" class="availability-notice" title="undefined" hidden=""><!----><!----></div>
    <mr-user-link aria-label="issue reporter"></mr-user-link>
            on 
      Wed, Jan 18, 2023, 5:31 AM EST
    <chops-timestamp title="Wed, Jan 18, 2023, 5:31 AM EST"></chops-timestamp>

          </small>

      Chrome Version       : 108.0.5359.124  109.0.5414.74 <span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version       : 108.0.5359.124  109.0.5414.74 <!----></span><br>URLs (if applicable) :<b class="line"><!---->URLs (if applicable) :<!----></b><br>None (published patch date)<span class="line"><!---->None (published patch date)<!----></span><br>TALOS-2023-1693<span class="line"><!---->TALOS-2023-1693<!----></span><br><br>Google Chrome WebRTC RTCStatsCollector out of bounds memory access vulnerability<span class="line"><!---->Google Chrome WebRTC RTCStatsCollector out of bounds memory access vulnerability<!----></span><br>Summary<span class="line"><!---->Summary<!----></span><br><br>An out of bounds memory access vulnerability exists in stats reporting functionality of the WebRTC implementation in Google Chrome 109.0.5414.74 and 108.0.5359.124. A specially-crafted malicious web page can trigger an out-of-bounds access which can lead to type confusion and further memory corruption. A victim would need to navigate to a malicious webpage to trigger this vulnerability.<span class="line"><!---->An out of bounds memory access vulnerability exists in stats reporting functionality of the WebRTC implementation in Google Chrome 109.0.5414.74 and 108.0.5359.124. A specially-crafted malicious web page can trigger an out-of-bounds access which can lead to type confusion and further memory corruption. A victim would need to navigate to a malicious webpage to trigger this vulnerability.<!----></span><br>Confirmed Vulnerable Versions<span class="line"><!---->Confirmed Vulnerable Versions<!----></span><br><br>The versions below were either tested or verified to be vulnerable by Talos or confirmed to be vulnerable by the vendor.<span class="line"><!---->The versions below were either tested or verified to be vulnerable by Talos or confirmed to be vulnerable by the vendor.<!----></span><br><br>Google Chrome 108.0.5359.124<span class="line"><!---->Google Chrome 108.0.5359.124<!----></span><br>Google Chrome 109.0.5414.74<span class="line"><!---->Google Chrome 109.0.5414.74<!----></span><br>Product URLs<span class="line"><!---->Product URLs<!----></span><br><br>Chrome - <span class="line"><!---->Chrome - <!----></span>https://www.google.com/chrome/<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://www.google.com/chrome/"><!---->https://www.google.com/chrome/<!----></a><br>CVSSv3 Score<span class="line"><!---->CVSSv3 Score<!----></span><br><br>8.3 - CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:R/S:U/C:H/I:H/A:L<span class="line"><!---->8.3 - CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:R/S:U/C:H/I:H/A:L<!----></span><br>CWE<span class="line"><!---->CWE<!----></span><br><br>CWE-129 - Improper Validation of Array Index<span class="line"><!---->CWE-129 - Improper Validation of Array Index<!----></span><br>Details<span class="line"><!---->Details<!----></span><br><br>Google Chrome is a cross-platform web browser developed by Google and is currently the most popular web browser. One of the features it supports is WebRTC which is primarily used for implementing web applications for real-time communication.<span class="line"><!---->Google Chrome is a cross-platform web browser developed by Google and is currently the most popular web browser. One of the features it supports is WebRTC which is primarily used for implementing web applications for real-time communication.<!----></span><br><br>PeerConnection object has a method called getStats which returns statistics about the overall connection. When generating stats report, the request is handled by the signaling thread.<span class="line"><!---->PeerConnection object has a method called getStats which returns statistics about the overall connection. When generating stats report, the request is handled by the signaling thread.<!----></span><br><br>Class responsible for generating the report is RTCStatsCollector. Collector uses caching to avoid doing expensive operations on each request. Therefore, if the request was received inside the caching window and there is previously generated cached report, that is delivered instead. If not, code goes into generating a new status report by generating partial results from network and signal thread and merging them.<span class="line"><!---->Class responsible for generating the report is RTCStatsCollector. Collector uses caching to avoid doing expensive operations on each request. Therefore, if the request was received inside the caching window and there is previously generated cached report, that is delivered instead. If not, code goes into generating a new status report by generating partial results from network and signal thread and merging them.<!----></span><br><br>RTCStatsCollector::ProducePartialResultsOnNetworkThread(...) is responsible for generating partial results on the network thread.<span class="line"><!---->RTCStatsCollector::ProducePartialResultsOnNetworkThread(...) is responsible for generating partial results on the network thread.<!----></span><br><br>void RTCStatsCollector::ProducePartialResultsOnNetworkThread(<span class="line"><!---->void RTCStatsCollector::ProducePartialResultsOnNetworkThread(<!----></span><br>    int64_t timestamp_us,<span class="line"><!---->    int64_t timestamp_us,<!----></span><br>    absl::optional<std::string> sctp_transport_name) {<span class="line"><!---->    absl::optional&lt;std::string&gt; These names are used to generate maps of cricket::TransportStats and CertificateStatsPair.<!----></span><br><br>If we look at the implemenation of RTCStatsCollector::PrepareTransportCertificateStats_n(...), we can see the following:<span class="line"><!---->If we look at the implemenation of RTCStatsCollector::PrepareTransportCertificateStats_n(...), we can see the following:<!----></span><br><br>// creates a new map<span class="line"><!---->// creates a new map<!----></span><br>std::map<std::string, CertificateStatsPair> transport_cert_stats;<span class="line"><!---->std::map&lt;std::string, CertificateStatsPair&gt; This will cause a reuse of |transport_cert_stats| which doesn't have certificate stats for the additional transport name that was added to the |transport_stats_by_name|.<span class="line"><!---->This can cause an issue when on the first getStats() call RTCStatsCollector instance caches the generated |transport_cert_stats| and before cache is cleared (e.g. setLocalDescription eventually clears the cache), issue an another getStats() with now additional transport name in the PeerConnection instance. This will cause a reuse of |transport_cert_stats| which doesn't have certificate stats for the additional transport name that was added to the |transport_stats_by_name|.<!----></span><br><br>const auto& certificate_stats_it =<span class="line"><!---->const auto&amp; certificate_stats_it =<!----></span><br>        transport_cert_stats.find(transport_name);<span class="line"><!---->        transport_cert_stats.find(transport_name);<!----></span><br>    RTC_DCHECK(certificate_stats_it != transport_cert_stats.cend());<span class="line"><!---->    RTC_DCHECK(certificate_stats_it != transport_cert_stats.cend());<!----></span><br><br>This situation will make transport_cert_stats.find(transport_name); fail and |certificate_stats_it| will be equal to transport_cert_stats.cend(). Subsequent use of the iterator will result in out of bounds memory access.<span class="line"><!---->This situation will make transport_cert_stats.find(transport_name); fail and |certificate_stats_it| will be equal to transport_cert_stats.cend(). Subsequent use of the iterator will result in out of bounds memory access.<!----></span><br><br>In the proof-of-concept, first getStats call will cache certificate stats of transport name 2 (which comes from |transceiver_stats_infos_|) but not for sctp transport name (which is 3) because it is not set by the signaling thread at the time of cache generation. But on the second getStats call transport name 3 is available so it gets included in the |transport_stats_by_name| but at this point cache has not yet been cleared.<span class="line"><!---->In the proof-of-concept, first getStats call will cache certificate stats of transport name 2 (which comes from |transceiver_stats_infos_|) but not for sctp transport name (which is 3) because it is not set by the signaling thread at the time of cache generation. But on the second getStats call transport name 3 is available so it gets included in the |transport_stats_by_name| but at this point cache has not yet been cleared.<!----></span><br>Crash Information<span class="line"><!---->Crash Information<!----></span><br><br>=================================================================<span class="line"><!---->=================================================================<!----></span><br>==2308409==ERROR: AddressSanitizer: SEGV on unknown address (pc 0x559193e4165d bp 0x7f2d1c0c5890 sp 0x7f2d1c0c5840 T39)<span class="line"><!---->==2308409==ERROR: AddressSanitizer: SEGV on unknown address (pc 0x559193e4165d bp 0x7f2d1c0c5890 sp 0x7f2d1c0c5840 T39)<!----></span><br>==2308409==The signal is caused by a READ memory access.<span class="line"><!---->==2308409==The signal is caused by a READ memory access.<!----></span><br>==2308409==Hint: this fault was caused by a dereference of a high value address (see register values below).         Thank you for that wonderfully detailed report. The certificate cache was added in M108 (<span class="line"><!---->Thank you for that wonderfully detailed report. The certificate cache was added in M108 (<!----></span>https://crbug.com/webrtc/14458<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/webrtc/issues/detail?id=14458" title="Add a cache for RTCCertificateStats"><!---->https://crbug.com/webrtc/14458<!----></a>) so let's assume that's where the bug first appeared.<span class="line"><!---->) so let's assume that's where the bug first appeared.<!----></span><br><br>I propose we fix this by handling the "certificate not found" case (it == end) by simply not setting the IDs in this case. Maybe there is a way to ensure the DCHECK always holds with other changes, but this seems like the most sensible thing to do right now.<span class="line"><!---->I propose we fix this by handling the "certificate not found" case (it == end) by simply not setting the IDs in this case. Maybe there is a way to ensure the DCHECK always holds with other changes, but this seems like the most sensible thing to do right now.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        by

        I wonder if the problem is that the cache is not cleared in all cases that it should be cleared, or if the problem is that this is inherently racy due to objects being created/destroyed on one thread and modified/stats collected on another thread, but it is interesting to note that this DCHECK has existed for several years so it is likely that it is caching related.<span class="line"><!---->I wonder if the problem is that the cache is not cleared in all cases that it should be cleared, or if the problem is that this is inherently racy due to objects being created/destroyed on one thread and modified/stats collected on another thread, but it is interesting to note that this DCHECK has existed for several years so it is likely that it is caching related.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Oh I see, creating a data channel may update the SCTP transport name but we forget to clear the cache.<span class="line"><!---->Oh I see, creating a data channel may update the SCTP transport name but we forget to clear the cache.<!----></span><br><br>So security issue can be avoided by handling the DCHECK case and the issue of certificates not being found due to caching can be fixed by clearing the cache. I'll write fixes for both of these, but perhaps we should only backmerge the DCHECK case to miniize risks.<span class="line"><!---->So security issue can be avoided by handling the DCHECK case and the issue of certificates not being found due to caching can be fixed by clearing the cache. I'll write fixes for both of these, but perhaps we should only backmerge the DCHECK case to miniize risks.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        A few things here, updating this issue as fixed as requesting merges before updating the bugs as Fixed interferes with our automation. Also, given this is a high-severity fix that is FoundIn-108, letting the bot do it's job would have been key to updating this with all the relevant merge request labels, including to M108, as this issue impacts Extended Stable. M109/Stable and M108/Extended respin RC cut deadline was Friday (or for some reason again today) so this fix missed merge for that. <span class="line"><!---->A few things here, updating this issue as fixed as requesting merges before updating the bugs as Fixed interferes with our automation. Also, given this is a high-severity fix that is FoundIn-108, letting the bot do it's job would have been key to updating this with all the relevant merge request labels, including to M108, as this issue impacts Extended Stable. M109/Stable and M108/Extended respin RC cut deadline was Friday (or for some reason again today) so this fix missed merge for that. <!----></span><br>Given the timelines, M109/Stable backmerge is no longer relevant. Removing the M109 merge label accordingly. <span class="line"><!---->Given the timelines, M109/Stable backmerge is no longer relevant. Removing the M109 merge label accordingly. <!----></span><br><br>In the future, please updated security bugs as Fixed as soon as the fix is landed. This allows Fixed security bugs to get labeled for the appropriate merge reviews, based on severity and impact AND gets them into the merge review queue as soon as possible. This is important in helping us keep our patch gap as small as possible and helps to combat n-day exploitation of our security bugs. Thank you to you and the webRTC team with this :)<span class="line"><!---->In the future, please updated security bugs as Fixed as soon as the fix is landed. This allows Fixed security bugs to get labeled for the appropriate merge reviews, based on severity and impact AND gets them into the merge review queue as soon as possible. Thank you to you and the webRTC team with this :)<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

        <div class="target-project-dialog">
          <h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          <div class="input-grid">
            <label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            <div>
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              <mr-autocomplete vocabularyname="project" for="targetProjectInput" role="listbox" id="chops-autocomplete-1"><!---->
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>
    <!----></mr-autocomplete>
            </div>

      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }

              Discard

              Convert issue

        }
        mr-launch-overview[hidden] {
          display: none;
        }
        mr-phase {
          margin-bottom: 0.75em;
        }
      </style>
      
      
    <!----></mr-launch-overview>
            </div>
          </div>
        </div>

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>

            Issue 1408392: TALOS-2023-1693 - Google Chrome WebRTC RTCStatsCollector out of bounds memory access vulnerability 
          <h1>
            
            Issue 1408392: TALOS-2023-1693 - Google Chrome WebRTC RTCStatsCollector out of bounds memory access vulnerability 
          </h1>
          
            Reported by
            
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>

            on

      Chrome Version       : 108.0.5359.124  109.0.5414.74 <span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version       : 108.0.5359.124  109.0.5414.74 <!----></span><br>URLs (if applicable) :<b class="line"><!---->URLs (if applicable) :<!----></b><br>None (published patch date)<span class="line"><!---->None (published patch date)<!----></span><br>TALOS-2023-1693<span class="line"><!---->TALOS-2023-1693<!----></span><br><br>Google Chrome WebRTC RTCStatsCollector out of bounds memory access vulnerability<span class="line"><!---->Google Chrome WebRTC RTCStatsCollector out of bounds memory access vulnerability<!----></span><br>Summary<span class="line"><!---->Summary<!----></span><br><br>An out of bounds memory access vulnerability exists in stats reporting functionality of the WebRTC implementation in Google Chrome 109.0.5414.74 and 108.0.5359.124. A specially-crafted malicious web page can trigger an out-of-bounds access which can lead to type confusion and further memory corruption. A victim would need to navigate to a malicious webpage to trigger this vulnerability.<span class="line"><!---->An out of bounds memory access vulnerability exists in stats reporting functionality of the WebRTC implementation in Google Chrome 109.0.5414.74 and 108.0.5359.124. A specially-crafted malicious web page can trigger an out-of-bounds access which can lead to type confusion and further memory corruption. A victim would need to navigate to a malicious webpage to trigger this vulnerability.<!----></span><br>Confirmed Vulnerable Versions<span class="line"><!---->Confirmed Vulnerable Versions<!----></span><br><br>The versions below were either tested or verified to be vulnerable by Talos or confirmed to be vulnerable by the vendor.<span class="line"><!---->The versions below were either tested or verified to be vulnerable by Talos or confirmed to be vulnerable by the vendor.<!----></span><br><br>Google Chrome 108.0.5359.124<span class="line"><!---->Google Chrome 108.0.5359.124<!----></span><br>Google Chrome 109.0.5414.74<span class="line"><!---->Google Chrome 109.0.5414.74<!----></span><br>Product URLs<span class="line"><!---->Product URLs<!----></span><br><br>Chrome - <span class="line"><!---->Chrome - <!----></span>https://www.google.com/chrome/<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://www.google.com/chrome/"><!---->https://www.google.com/chrome/<!----></a><br>CVSSv3 Score<span class="line"><!---->CVSSv3 Score<!----></span><br><br>8.3 - CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:R/S:U/C:H/I:H/A:L<span class="line"><!---->8.3 - CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:R/S:U/C:H/I:H/A:L<!----></span><br>CWE<span class="line"><!---->CWE<!----></span><br><br>CWE-129 - Improper Validation of Array Index<span class="line"><!---->CWE-129 - Improper Validation of Array Index<!----></span><br>Details<span class="line"><!---->Details<!----></span><br><br>Google Chrome is a cross-platform web browser developed by Google and is currently the most popular web browser. One of the features it supports is WebRTC which is primarily used for implementing web applications for real-time communication.<span class="line"><!---->Google Chrome is a cross-platform web browser developed by Google and is currently the most popular web browser. One of the features it supports is WebRTC which is primarily used for implementing web applications for real-time communication.<!----></span><br><br>PeerConnection object has a method called getStats which returns statistics about the overall connection. When generating stats report, the request is handled by the signaling thread.<span class="line"><!---->PeerConnection object has a method called getStats which returns statistics about the overall connection. When generating stats report, the request is handled by the signaling thread.<!----></span><br><br>Class responsible for generating the report is RTCStatsCollector. Collector uses caching to avoid doing expensive operations on each request. Therefore, if the request was received inside the caching window and there is previously generated cached report, that is delivered instead. If not, code goes into generating a new status report by generating partial results from network and signal thread and merging them.<span class="line"><!---->Class responsible for generating the report is RTCStatsCollector.         Thank you for that wonderfully detailed report. The certificate cache was added in M108 (<span class="line"><!---->Thank you for that wonderfully detailed report. The certificate cache was added in M108 (<!----></span>https://crbug.com/webrtc/14458<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/webrtc/issues/detail?id=14458" title="Add a cache for RTCCertificateStats"><!---->https://crbug.com/webrtc/14458<!----></a>) so let's assume that's where the bug first appeared.<span class="line"><!---->) so let's assume that's where the bug first appeared.<!----></span><br><br>I propose we fix this by handling the "certificate not found" case (it == end) by simply not setting the IDs in this case. Maybe there is a way to ensure the DCHECK always holds with other changes, but this seems like the most sensible thing to do right now.<span class="line"><!---->I propose we fix this by handling the "certificate not found" case (it == end) by simply not setting the IDs in this case.         I wonder if the problem is that the cache is not cleared in all cases that it should be cleared, or if the problem is that this is inherently racy due to objects being created/destroyed on one thread and modified/stats collected on another thread, but it is interesting to note that this DCHECK has existed for several years so it is likely that it is caching related.<span class="line"><!---->I wonder if the problem is that the cache is not cleared in all cases that it should be cleared, or if the problem is that this is inherently racy due to objects being created/destroyed on one thread and modified/stats collected on another thread, but it is interesting to note that this DCHECK has existed for several years so it is likely that it is caching related.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Oh I see, creating a data channel may update the SCTP transport name but we forget to clear the cache.<span class="line"><!---->Oh I see, creating a data channel may update the SCTP transport name but we forget to clear the cache.<!----></span><br><br>So security issue can be avoided by handling the DCHECK case and the issue of certificates not being found due to caching can be fixed by clearing the cache. I'll write fixes for both of these, but perhaps we should only backmerge the DCHECK case to miniize risks.<span class="line"><!---->So security issue can be avoided by handling the DCHECK case and the issue of certificates not being found due to caching can be fixed by clearing the cache. I'll write fixes for both of these, but perhaps we should only backmerge the DCHECK case to miniize risks.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1408392#c26">Comment 26<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Mon, Jan 23, 2023, 2:04 PM EST"></chops-timestamp>

          Status:<strong><!---->Status:</strong>
